questions.text: In which type of join are all rows from the table listed first in the query included, regardless of whether they match rows from the table listed second in the query?
questions.explanation: In a left outer join, all rows from the table on the left (listed first) are included, even if they don't match rows on the right.

questions.text: In a relational database, _____
options: a. relations must include repeating groups
b. each row should be unique
c. columns should be ordered correctly
d. rows must be ordered numerically
questions.correctAnswer: b. each row should be unique
questions.explanation: Each row must be unique in a relational database, with no identical rows.

questions.text: The default transaction mode in Oracle, which commits each action query as soon as the user executes the query, is _____
questions.explanation: Autocommit commits (makes permanent) each action query immediately after execution.

questions.text: The SALES_REP table consists of the sales representatives' IDs, first names, last names, addresses, mobile numbers, total commissions, and _____
questions.explanation: The table stores sales rep information, including commission rates and IDs.

questions.text: When creating a stored procedure to retrieve a single row with embedded SQL, you must place the procedural code _____
options: c. between the BEGIN and END commands
d. inside a SELECT or WHERE clause
questions.correctAnswer: c. between the BEGIN and END commands
questions.explanation: Procedural code must be placed between the BEGIN and END commands.

questions.text: Diamonds are sometimes used in E-R diagrams to _____
options: a. describe the relationship between two tables
c. indicate which entity is on the 'many' side of a one-to-many relationship
d. identify the names of entities in a database
questions.correctAnswer: a. describe the relationship between two tables
questions.explanation: In E-R diagrams, diamonds represent relationships between entities.

questions.text: What keyword do you use to tell MySQL to use a different character to signal the end of a statement when executing multiple commands?
questions.explanation: The DELIMITER keyword tells MySQL to treat statements separated by the defined delimiter as one block.

questions.text: When a query includes the clause `FROM CLIENT A, CLIENT B`, SQL will _____
options: b. treat it as a query of two tables, A and B
c. treat it as a union of two tables, A and B
questions.correctAnswer: b. treat it as a query of two tables, A and B
questions.explanation: SQL interprets this as a query involving two instances of the CLIENT table.

questions.text: When adding a row with incomplete data to a SQL table, _____
options: a. you use the INSERT command and enter a value of null for columns without data
b. you must change the table structure to mark all rows as NOT NULL
c. you use the INSERT command and name the columns for which you are entering data
d. the DBMS will reject the new row the first time you execute the command
questions.correctAnswer: c. you use the INSERT command and name the columns for which you are entering data
questions.explanation: You can insert rows with partial data by specifying columns and leaving others null.

questions.text: Preceding a condition with which SQL operator reverses the truth of the original condition?
questions.explanation: The NOT operator reverses the truth of the specified condition.

questions.text: Which command shows the structure of the COFFEE table, including column names, data types, and null acceptance?
questions.explanation: The DESCRIBE command reveals the structure of the table, including its columns and types.

questions.text: When designing a database, _____
options: a. you can identify relationships by looking for matching rows
b. relationships may be determined directly from the requirements
c. functional dependencies should not be in the same table
d. the 'many' part of a relationship is always the primary key
questions.correctAnswer: b. relationships may be determined directly from the requirements
questions.explanation: Database design often involves identifying relationships directly from business requirements.

questions.text: In SQL, the specific order of query results is determined by the _____
questions.explanation: The ORDER BY clause specifies the sort key for ordered results.

questions.text: When an OWNER table stores information for a StayWell property, which data is stored?
options: a. an owner ID for each person
b. a group ID instead of an owner ID
c. a row for each individual owner
questions.explanation: StayWell stores only the primary contact information for owners.

questions.text: Which SQL command changes the default database to SPIDERS?
questions.explanation: The `USE` command sets the default database to the specified name.

questions.text: One can successfully design a database system without fully understanding functional dependence.
questions.explanation: Functional dependence is essential for creating efficient and normalized databases.

questions.text: What happens if Samantha tries to insert a row into a table through a view that shows only part of the base table?
options: a. The new row will contain several null values.
b. The INSERT will fail if all columns in the base table allow nulls.
c. A row with a duplicate primary key may be added.
d. The INSERT will automatically be rejected.
questions.correctAnswer: a. The new row will contain several null values.
questions.explanation: The DBMS inserts null values for columns not included in the view.

questions.text: When renaming columns for a view, the new names are included in _____
questions.explanation: Column names are enclosed in parentheses following the view name.

questions.text: Which MySQL command displays all tables in the ELPATRON database?
questions.explanation: This query lists all tables in the specified schema.

questions.text: Once you've verified that an update is correct, which command makes it permanent?
questions.explanation: The COMMIT command saves changes permanently in the database.

questions.text: In which type of join are all rows from the table listed first in the query included, regardless of whether they match rows from the table listed second in the query?
questions.explanation: In a left outer join, all rows from the table on the left (listed first) are included, even if they don't match rows on the right.

d. rows must be ordered numerically

questions.explanation: Each row must be unique in a relational database, with no identical rows.

questions.explanation: Autocommit commits (makes permanent) each action query immediately after execution.
